title: Can someone with dementia have a power of attorney file their chapter 7 bankruptcy for them on their behalf & go to court for ?
question: Can a family member file the chapter 7, meet with an attorney, go to court, etc. on behalf on an elderly family member with mid-dementia who has debt issues? The family member has power of attorney. How would this work?
answers: In my opinion a durable PoA executed while the person was competent should allow the designated person to sign and file the Petition on behalf of the impaired debtor.

In theory, yes, a bankruptcy could be filed and prosecuted pursuant to a durable power of attorney. One wonders, however. whether it would be advisable to obtain a conservatorship from the probate court before filing the bankruptcy.
